official_title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to provide that no deduction shall be allowed for the living expenses of Members of Congress in the Washington D. C. area for any day unless the Member certifies that he was physically present in such area by reason of official business on such day, and for other purposes.

summary.text: Amends the Internal Revenue Code to limit the income tax deduction for living expenses for Members of Congress to days when Members certify that they are physically present in Washington, D.C. for official business.
